1.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience

2.brief: as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
where?; hence, whither?, when?; also hither and thither
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to crumble; transitively, to bruise (literally or figuratively)
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic

3.brief: the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
ten (as an accumulation to the extent of the digits)
a stroke, literally or figuratively (in various applications, as follow)
properly, to wound; but only figuratively, to taunt or insult
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed

4.brief: meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
to stray (causatively, mislead), usually (figuratively) to mistake, especially (morally) to transgress; by extension (through the idea of intoxication) to reel, (figuratively) be enraptured
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
to stop (usually over night); by implication, to stay permanently; hence (in a bad sense) to be obstinate (especially in words, to complain)

5.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride)
to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

strictly a demonstrative particle, here; but used of time, now or then
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a net, or (abstractly) capture; also a fastness
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to strike with more or less violence (beat, fell, corrode); by implication (of attack) to knock together, i.e. surround or circulate

violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
properly, to be free; but used only causatively and reflexively, to halloo (for help, i.e. freedom from some trouble)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style

8.brief: a well-trodden road (literally or figuratively); also a caravan
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)

9.brief: properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to spread out (i.e. deploy in hostile array); by analogy, to strip (i.e. unclothe, plunder, flay, etc.)
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)

10.brief: (as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
properly, to pull up, especially the tent-pins, i.e. start on ajourney
a tree (from its firmness); hence, wood (plural sticks)
literally a cord (as an attachment); figuratively, expectancy

11.brief: to glow or grow warm; figuratively (usually) to blaze up, of anger, zeal, jealousy
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire

12.brief: to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
to mound up (especially a turnpike); figurative, to exalt; reflexively, to oppose (as by a dam)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

14.brief: properly, to be flabby, i.e. (by implication) desist; (figuratively) be lacking or idle

to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention

a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery

to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce

properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)

17.brief: wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything

18.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue

19.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, an adult (as of full length); by implication, a man (only in the plural)
a session, i.e. company of persons (in close deliberation); by implication, intimacy, consultation, a secret
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert

flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
properly, to impinge, i.e. cling or adhere; figuratively, to catch by pursuit
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
properly, to be smooth, i.e. (by implication) to escape (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to release or rescue; specifically, to bring forth young, emit sparks
skin (as naked); by implication, hide, leather
a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff
